quest.name: Appetite for Destruction
journal: Time is running out to rescue D'zentsa, and Widargelt is uncharacteristically unsettled.

Though you have not found a way to open your final chakra, you must confront H'raha Tia now, or D'zentsa's life will be forfeit. Widargelt bids you join him and O'tchakha near Little Ala Mhigo in southern Thanalan ahead of the rescue mission.

Desperate to save her friend, O'tchakha bids you fight her, that you might open your final chakra. However, Widargelt will not hear of it. He harbors the hope that, in joining hands, you may yet defeat H'raha Tia. Prepare yourself for the confrontation, and tell Widargelt when you are ready to proceed to the southern ruins, where D'zentsa has been taken.

At the ruins, Widargelt attempts to convince H'raha Tia that fighting one another is not the way. Alas, the master of the sect of shadow will not be swayed from his beliefs, and he sets upon you with fists and feet flying. In the midst of battle, your final chakra opens, allowing you to do battle with H'raha Tia on even footing. And with D'zentsa's belated help, you succeed in overcoming him and his pupils. As the dust settles, speak with Widargelt south of Little Ala Mhigo to know his mind on the battle's outcome.

The pursuit of power was once thought to be the sole route to greatness among the disciples of the Fist of Rhalgr. But by your shining example, this old preconception has been shattered, giving way to alternate paths. Together with D'zentsa and O'tchakha, Widargelt will strive to rebuild the order as it once was, reuniting the sects of light and shadow. As the paragon for a new generation of monks, see to it that you ever exercise your powers for the good of the realm.

※The next monk quest will be available from Erik once you have met the following requirements:
※ FINAL FANTASY XIV: Stormblood must be registered to your service account.
※ You must have completed the main scenario quest “The Far Edge of Fate.”
objectives: Speak with O'tchakha near Little Ala Mhigo.
Hold off H'raha Tia until D'zentsa is free!

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Time is running out. D'zentsa's life will soon be forfeit. We must act now.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Alas, we did not find it. A way to open the seventh chakra. But we must act nonetheless.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: O'tchakha has gone to Little Ala Mhigo. She fears for her friend. Let us join her.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: We must rescue D'zentsa. But how...?

dialogue.name: OTCHAKHA
dialogue.text: Zentsa is still alive, but I fear she'll not remain so much longer. But moments ago, she was taken to the ruins to the south.

dialogue.name: OTCHAKHA
dialogue.text: You will have already heard, but I couldn't find a bloodless way to open chakra of an opposing aspect.

dialogue.name: OTCHAKHA
dialogue.text: Thus far, you have opened thirteen chakra─the most of us three. But one more, and you could face H'raha Tia as an equal...

dialogue.name: OTCHAKHA
dialogue.text: Fight me, Forename, and make the final chakra yours!

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: How will you respond?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Very well. Let's get this over with.

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: No, this isn't the way.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: No, sisterbrother! If O'tchakha dies, victory would have no meaning!

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: We need power. This is true. But at what cost? You must remember what is truly important. Or you will commit a grave mistake. As I once did.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Listen to Forename. SheHe speaks the truth. It is not the way.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: We need power. This is true. But at what cost? If you die, D'zentsa would grieve. Victory would have no meaning.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Remember my words. All our chakra may not be open. But we have each other. Together, we can defeat H'raha Tia. We can rescue D'zentsa.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: The disciples of our sects once fought side by side. Let us do so again. As we did in the days of old.

dialogue.name: OTCHAKHA
dialogue.text: Thank you, Widargelt. I shall stand with you.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: First, I will try to persuade H'raha Tia. Convince him to see reason. But if my words fail, be ready to fight.

dialogue.name: OTCHAKHA
dialogue.text: Zentsa was taken to the ruins to the south. We must hurry before it's too late!

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: We go to confront H'raha Tia. Are you ready, sisterbrother?

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Hear me, H'raha Tia! We come, but not to accept your demands!

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Nay, we would remind you of the past! Of the true nature of our order!

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Our two sects once fought beside each other. Not against. Together, we can achieve much. Let us join hands, brother. And rebuild the Fist of Rhalgr!

dialogue.name: HRAHATIA
dialogue.text: Hmph, cowards like you bring shame upon our order. Plainly, it is you who needs to be reminded of our true nature.

dialogue.name: HRAHATIA
dialogue.text: The arduous training to hone mind and body, the blood we spill and shed─all of it is for no other purpose but to honor the Destroyer.

dialogue.name: HRAHATIA
dialogue.text: We pay Him great tribute by dueling to the death. And in return, He grants us great power: the power of all fourteen chakra.

dialogue.name: HRAHATIA
dialogue.text: By consorting with the royal house, the disciples of light lost sight of their true nature. For this, Rhalgr visited destruction upon them.

dialogue.name: HRAHATIA
dialogue.text: But in His wisdom, you were spared, that your existence─feeble though it is─might serve to raise us higher. Upon your battered bodies, the Fist of Rhalgr shall be restored to its former glory!

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: You are wrong. The sect of light was undone, but not as you say. We misused our power. We turned it upon our own people. For this, we were cast down.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Now you misuse your power. You turn it upon your own comrades. It is the same. It will end the same. You will destroy yourselves as we did.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Do not make the same mistake, brother. If we are to survive, we must find another way. A way to prosper together. Or we shall perish in vain. All of us.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Those who have power must choose. You must choose. With it, will you pave the way for life? Or will you destroy it? Surely, the choice is clear.

dialogue.name: HRAHATIA
dialogue.text: I grow weary of your blathering. You have already declared your unwillingness to meet my demands. There is naught more to discuss.

dialogue.name: HRAHATIA
dialogue.text: Take the adventurer alive─shehe will yet prove useful to us. Kill the rest!

dialogue.name: OTCHAKHA
dialogue.text: Zentsa! Are you all right!?

dialogue.name: DZENTSA
dialogue.text: You came... Thank you...

dialogue.name: HRAHATIA
dialogue.text: So you have turned against me, the both of you. Have you forgotten who it was that saved you all those years ago?

dialogue.name: HRAHATIA
dialogue.text: But I pride myself on being a forgiving man. In lieu of an apology, I shall accept your life force.

dialogue.name: HRAHATIA
dialogue.text: Ahahaha! Your power is mine! Be glad, my wayward pupils, that you were useful to me at the end!

dialogue.name: HRAHATIA
dialogue.text: Magnificent! My body is as a raging furnace! It shall be as child's play to unleash my ultimate technique!

dialogue.name: HRAHATIA
dialogue.text: It ends here!

dialogue.name: HRAHATIA
dialogue.text: What!?

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Can it be? Your final chakra has opened?

dialogue.name: DZENTSA
dialogue.text: That's the only explanation! Which means that Forename's now an equal with H'raha Tia!

dialogue.name: OTCHAKHA
dialogue.text: If we fight together, we may yet triumph!

dialogue.name: HRAHATIA
dialogue.text: Triumph, you say? I do not recall having raised such a foolish child.

dialogue.name: HRAHATIA
dialogue.text: Forename is as a suckling babe with herhis new chakra, while my entire being is fairly ablaze with the life energy of three monks!

dialogue.name: HRAHATIA
dialogue.text: It matters not how many of you there are! You cannot hope to defeat me!

dialogue.name: DZENTSA
dialogue.text: Tchakha has told me everything. Thank you, Forename.

dialogue.name: OTCHAKHA
dialogue.text: To be reunited with Zentsa... Words cannot well express my relief.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: It is over. Zentsa is safe. Together, we achieved the impossible.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Yet my heart is heavy. I failed to convince H'raha Tia.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Every step I take, blood is spilled. With my power, I know only destruction.

dialogue.name: DZENTSA
dialogue.text: That's not true, Widargelt. A monk's power can also be used to save, like you saved us.

dialogue.name: OTCHAKHA
dialogue.text: We have a favor to ask of you. If you are still intent on rebuilding the Fist of Rhalgr, we would lend you our aid.

dialogue.name: DZENTSA
dialogue.text: We'd bring whoever's left of our sect. Together, we can restore the order to the way it used to be, with disciples of light and shadow side by side.

dialogue.name: DZENTSA
dialogue.text: And together, we can think about what power means to us. Thinking about it alone, your mind's liable to take you to a dark place. Better to have comrades around who share your cause, I reckon.

dialogue.name: OTCHAKHA
dialogue.text: With H'raha Tia gone, Forename is the only soul left who has opened all fourteen chakra. And a soul of gentleness shehe is.

dialogue.name: OTCHAKHA
dialogue.text: SheHe did not seek power for its own sake, yet shehe has reached the zenith of our art. In so doing, shehe has shattered our old preconceptions and shown us another path.

dialogue.name: OTCHAKHA
dialogue.text: And in opening herhis final chakra by stopping Master's technique, shehe has given us hope that there is a way to open all chakra without bloodshed.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Thank you, D'zentsa, O'tchakha. Together, we will create a new path. And lay a new foundation for our order!

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Forename. It is to your shining example that we turn.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: You are as a star. We look up to it. We strive to reach its heights.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: The way may be dark. And it may be filled with hardship. But come what may, we will forge on. Towards your light.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Promise me this, sisterbrother. Ever use your powers for good. And for the realm!

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: This concludes the monk quests for FINAL FANTASY XIV: Heavensward. In order to undertake the next series of quests, you must first meet the following requirements:

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text:
※ FINAL FANTASY XIV: Stormblood must be registered to your service account.
※ You must have completed the main scenario quest “The Far Edge of Fate.”

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Once you have done so, the next monk quest will be available from Erik.

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: I was not strong enough...

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Ungh... Please take care of Zentsa...

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: I'm sorry, Tchakha...

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Hold off H'raha Tia, Forename! We will unbind D'zentsa!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Hold on, Zentsa!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Tchakha!? And you two as well!?

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: You think you can defeat me? Fools!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Impressive. Mayhap a different approach is in order.

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Beware, Forename! I sense a torrent of energy!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: It seems your awakening is at hand. How curious.

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Their ranks have thinned out! Now's our chance!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Such power! My body can scarcely contain it!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Fear not, sisterbrother! You are now his equal!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Focus on Master, Forename! We'll keep the rest occupied!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Past time I made myself useful!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Play time is over! Prepare yourselves!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Something comes! Be careful!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Master, please! We need not fight any longer! There is another way!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Forename opened herhis final chakra, and shehe did it without hurting you!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: This changes nothing. Mine is the one true path. It is to exalt Rhalgr that we fight.

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: So it ends here...
